bridge_axioms.name: mpa_biomass_dive_tourism_value
bridge_axioms.description: Fish biomass increases in MPAs drive increased diver willingness-to-pay and tourism revenue
bridge_axioms.formula: tourism_revenue = f(biomass_increase, wtp_curve, infrastructure)

wtp_increase_max_percent.extraction_note: 84% is stated as upper bound ('up to 84%'); lower bound estimated from methodology (random forest on 27,609 dive sites). Main text, Results section.

biomass_contribution_percent.extraction_note: 47% stated as point estimate, no CI in main text. Bounds estimated from model decomposition (biomass 47% + biodiversity 49% + MPA name 4% = 100%).

avg_biomass_increase_percent.extraction_note: Mean 113% with std dev 133% from global analysis. CI estimated as mean +/- 1 std dev, clamped at 50% lower bound.

global_additional_revenue_usd_millions.extraction_note: $616M point estimate, no CI in paper. Bounds estimated at +/-35% based on input parameter sensitivity.

bridge_axioms.validation: Full protection -> 113% biomass increase -> up to 84% higher WTP -> 47% of total revenue improvement

bridge_axioms.name: notake_mpa_biomass_multiplier
bridge_axioms.description: No-take MPAs accumulate fish biomass relative to unprotected areas
bridge_axioms.formula: biomass_ratio = f(protection_type, enforcement, age)

biomass_ratio.extraction_note: Global meta-analysis of 82 MPA studies. 95% CI [4.5, 8.9]. Only 18/82 provided temporal data for trend detection.

recovery_rate_per_year.extraction_note: Recovery rate from temporal subset (18 studies). Bounds estimated from study-to-study variation.

bridge_axioms.validation: 10-year-old enforced no-take reserve has 670% of unprotected biomass

bridge_axioms.name: sea_otter_kelp_carbon_cascade
bridge_axioms.description: Sea otter presence drives trophic cascade increasing kelp carbon storage
bridge_axioms.formula: carbon_storage = otter_presence * npp_multiplier * kelp_area

npp_multiplier.extraction_note: Computed from NPP range endpoints: min ratio 313/70=4.5, max ratio 900/25=36. Central estimate 12x.

bridge_axioms.name: coral_reef_flood_protection
bridge_axioms.description: Coral reef structural integrity reduces coastal flood damages
bridge_axioms.formula: flood_protection_value = reef_condition * wave_attenuation * exposure

global_protection_value_usd_billion.extraction_note: 71,000 km reef coastline at 2km resolution (~35,500 profiles). No explicit CI in paper; ~10% sensitivity from friction/wave parameters. 100-year storm scenario.

wave_energy_reduction_percent.extraction_note: 97% from Ferrario et al. 2014 meta-analysis of reef wave attenuation. Bounds from study variation.

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_flood_protection
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove extent and width provide coastal flood protection
bridge_axioms.formula: flood_protection_value = mangrove_area * storm_attenuation

global_protection_value_usd_billion.extraction_note: Point estimate from paper; bounds estimated at +/-20% based on typical ESV transfer error.

value_per_ha_yr_usd.extraction_note: Mean $4,185, median $239, range $100-$57,000 from meta-analysis. Extreme right skew indicates lognormal.

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_fisheries_production
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove extent correlates with adjacent fisheries catches
bridge_axioms.formula: fisheries_value = mangrove_fringe_ha * value_per_ha

value_per_ha_yr_usd.extraction_note: Median value from Gulf of California study. Bounds estimated at +/-60% from cross-site variation.

species_mangrove_dependent_fraction.extraction_note: Proportion of species dependent on mangroves. Bounds estimated from regional variation.

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_carbon_stock
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove ecosystems store exceptional carbon per hectare
bridge_axioms.formula: carbon_stock = mangrove_condition * carbon_density

undisturbed_mg_c_ha.extraction_note: From Donato et al. 2011. Bounds estimated at +/-20% from site-level variation in Indo-Pacific mangroves.

bridge_axioms.name: seagrass_carbon_credit_value
bridge_axioms.description: Seagrass conservation and restoration generate carbon credit revenue
bridge_axioms.formula: carbon_revenue = project_type * area * credit_price

net_offset_t_co2e_ha_yr.extraction_note: From Oreska et al. 2020. Bounds estimated at +/-50% from site-level variation.

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_restoration_bcr
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove restoration yields positive benefit-cost ratios
bridge_axioms.formula: net_benefit = esv_gain - restoration_cost

bcr_range.extraction_note: BCR range 6.35-15.0 from Zeng et al. 2025. Midpoint 10.68 as mode.

bridge_axioms.name: kelp_forest_global_value
bridge_axioms.description: Kelp forests provide substantial ecosystem services globally
bridge_axioms.formula: esv_total = kelp_area * per_ha_value

global_value_usd_billion_yr.extraction_note: From Eger et al. 2023. Bounds estimated at +/-30% based on per-hectare value range.

value_per_ha_yr_range_usd.extraction_note: Range $64,400-$147,100/ha/yr from paper. Midpoint $105,750 as central estimate.

bridge_axioms.name: mpa_climate_resilience
bridge_axioms.description: MPAs enhance ecosystem resilience to climate disturbances
bridge_axioms.formula: resilience_multiplier = f(mpa_type, habitat)

kelp_recovery_premium_percent.extraction_note: 8.5% from Ortiz-Villa et al. 2024 California MPA study. Bounds estimated from cross-site variation.

coral_disturbance_reduction_percent.extraction_note: Bounds estimated at +/-50% around point estimate.

bridge_axioms.name: reef_degradation_fisheries_loss
bridge_axioms.description: Coral reef structural degradation reduces fisheries productivity
bridge_axioms.formula: fisheries_loss = structural_degradation * productivity_coeff

productivity_loss_percent.extraction_note: 35% from Rogers et al. 2018, with stated range 25-50%. Direct from paper.

bridge_axioms.name: seagrass_carbon_sequestration_rate
bridge_axioms.description: Seagrass meadows sequester atmospheric CO2 through photosynthetic fixation and long-term burial of organic carbon in anoxic sediment soils
bridge_axioms.formula: IF seagrass_area_ha(Site, A) AND seagrass_condition(Site, C) THEN carbon_sequestration_tCO2_yr(Site, A * rate * C)

sequestration_rate_tCO2_ha_yr.extraction_note: Conservative estimate for verified carbon credit projects. Natural gross sequestration can exceed 4 tCO2/ha/yr. Value accounts for additionality, leakage, and buffer deductions per VCS methodology. Lognormal distribution supported by right-skewed carbon stock data across 2700+ cores (Krause et al. 2025).

gross_npp_kg_C_ha_yr.extraction_note: Mean 5833 +/- 557 kg C/ha/yr from global synthesis of seagrass biomass and production data.

burial_efficiency_fraction.extraction_note: Approximately 20% of NPP is buried in seagrass sediment contributing to long-term sequestration. Varies with environmental and geomorphological conditions.

soil_carbon_stock_Mg_Corg_ha_top30cm_med.extraction_note: Median with IQR from global synthesis of 2700+ seagrass soil cores. 27% lower than previous global estimates.

bridge_axioms.validation: 100 ha healthy seagrass meadow sequesters ~84 tCO2/yr (range 40-180 tCO2/yr)

bridge_axioms.name: carbon_stock_to_credit_value
bridge_axioms.description: Seagrass carbon sequestration generates revenue through voluntary carbon credit markets, with prices reflecting credit quality and blue carbon premium
bridge_axioms.formula: IF sequestration_tCO2_yr(Site, S) AND credit_price_usd(Market, P) THEN annual_credit_revenue_usd(Site, S * P)

price_per_tCO2_usd.extraction_note: Central estimate $30/tCO2 based on S&P Global Platts DBC-1 blue carbon benchmark at $29.30/tCO2e (Aug 2025 record). Range $15-50 reflects voluntary carbon market stratification by credit quality (high-quality credits average $14.80, premium blue carbon commands higher prices).

conservation_100ha_max_revenue_usd_10yr.extraction_note: Maximum 10-year revenue for 100ha seagrass conservation project from Duarte et al. 2025. Bounds estimated from project type variation.

net_offset_tCO2e_ha_yr.extraction_note: Net GHG offset from seagrass restoration, accounting for CH4 and N2O fluxes. From Oreska et al. 2020. Bounds estimated at +/-50% from site-level variation.

bridge_axioms.name: habitat_loss_carbon_emission
bridge_axioms.description: Seagrass habitat loss exposes stored sediment carbon to oxic conditions, causing remineralization and CO2 emissions that can be quantified as an emission factor per hectare lost
bridge_axioms.formula: IF seagrass_loss_ha(Site, L) AND remineralization_fraction(F) THEN emission_tCO2(Site, L * stock_per_ha * F)

emission_factor_tCO2_per_ha.extraction_note: Derived from top-meter soil carbon stock (~140 Mg C/ha = 520 tCO2/ha) with variable remineralization fractions (10-50% per Arias-Ortiz et al. 2018, 53% per Krause et al. 2025). Low bound: 520 * 0.22 = 112; high bound: 520 * 0.92 = 476. Central estimate 294 represents ~57% remineralization. Triangular distribution reflects asymmetric uncertainty in remineralization rates.

soil_carbon_stock_top1m_tCO2_ha.extraction_note: ~140 Mg C/ha * 3.67 = 520 tCO2/ha for seagrass soils in top meter. Range reflects variability across plant functional groups and coastal settings.

remineralization_fraction.extraction_note: 53% remineralization over 25 years from Krause et al. 2025 empirically-derived formula. Arias-Ortiz et al. 2018 used 10-50% range for Shark Bay. Wider range reflects diverse disturbance scenarios.

global_at_risk_emissions_Tg_CO2.extraction_note: Total global seagrass carbon at risk if no conservation action taken. Social cost $213 billion (2020 USD).

bridge_axioms.validation: Loss of 1,000 ha seagrass could release ~294,000 tCO2 (range 112,000-476,000 tCO2)

bridge_axioms.name: mpa_protection_carbon_permanence
bridge_axioms.description: MPA designation and enforcement reduce permanence risk for blue carbon stocks by mitigating direct anthropogenic threats, though climate-driven risks persist
bridge_axioms.formula: IF mpa_type(Site, 'no_take') AND enforced(Site, TRUE) THEN permanence_years(Site, P) AND risk_reduction(direct_threats, R)

permanence_years.extraction_note: Central estimate 50 years based on VCS crediting period norms and MPA governance timescales. Low bound 25 years reflects minimum viable crediting period. High bound 100 years reflects well-governed long-term MPAs. Lovelock et al. 2025 found 85% of SE Asian mangroves face permanence risks from socioeconomic and climate factors.

socioeconomic_risk_fraction.extraction_note: 85% of SE Asian mangroves face permanence risks from oil palm, rice, and aquaculture conversion pressure. Bounds estimated from regional variation.

climate_risk_heatwave_loss_fraction.extraction_note: 36% of Shark Bay seagrass damaged by 2010/2011 marine heatwave. Bounds reflect range of heatwave severity scenarios.

bridge_axioms.validation: Well-governed no-take MPA provides ~50-year carbon permanence (range 25-100 years), requiring buffer pool for climate risk

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_carbon_sequestration_rate
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove ecosystems sequester atmospheric carbon at high annual rates through biomass accumulation and sediment burial
bridge_axioms.formula: IF mangrove_area_ha(Site, A) AND mangrove_condition(Site, C) THEN carbon_sequestration_tCO2_yr(Site, A * rate * C)

sequestration_rate_tCO2_ha_yr.extraction_note: Derived from Donato et al. 2011 carbon density data and Murdiyarso et al. 2023 emission factors. Range reflects high variability across mangrove types and geomorphic settings.

aboveground_sequestration_fraction.extraction_note: From Alongi 2014 review of mangrove carbon cycling. Approximately 30% in aboveground biomass, 70% belowground.

bridge_axioms.validation: 100 ha healthy mangrove sequesters ~640 tCO2/yr (range 210-1,080 tCO2/yr)

bridge_axioms.name: kelp_carbon_export
bridge_axioms.description: Kelp forests export dissolved and particulate organic carbon to the deep ocean via DOC/POC pathways, contributing to long-term carbon sequestration
bridge_axioms.formula: IF kelp_forest_area_ha(Site, A) THEN carbon_export_tC_yr(Site, A * export_rate)

carbon_export_rate_tC_ha_yr.extraction_note: From Krause-Jensen & Duarte 2016. Macroalgae export 0.34 tC/ha/yr to deep ocean via DOC/POC. Range reflects variability in export efficiency by current regime and depth.

sequestration_efficiency_percent.extraction_note: 11% of macroalgal NPP reaches the deep sea for long-term sequestration. Bounds from uncertainty in export pathways.

bridge_axioms.validation: 1,000 ha kelp forest exports ~340 tC/yr to deep ocean (range 100-680 tC/yr)

bridge_axioms.name: salt_marsh_carbon_sequestration
bridge_axioms.description: Salt marshes sequester atmospheric carbon through annual burial in waterlogged sediments, creating long-term carbon sinks
bridge_axioms.formula: IF salt_marsh_area_ha(Site, A) AND condition(Site, C) THEN carbon_sequestration_tCO2_yr(Site, A * rate * C)

sequestration_rate_tCO2_ha_yr.extraction_note: From Howard et al. 2017 blue carbon primer. Salt marsh burial rates 0.9-3.8 tCO2/ha/yr depending on latitude and sediment supply.

bridge_axioms.validation: 100 ha salt marsh sequesters ~210 tCO2/yr (range 90-380 tCO2/yr)

bridge_axioms.name: blue_carbon_additionality
bridge_axioms.description: Carbon credit projects must demonstrate additionality - the difference between project sequestration and counterfactual baseline
bridge_axioms.formula: IF project_sequestration_tCO2(Site, S) AND baseline_sequestration_tCO2(Site, B) THEN creditable_tCO2(Site, (S - B) * additionality_rate)

additionality_rate.extraction_note: 40-60% additionality rate for blue carbon projects. Range reflects project type variation (conservation vs restoration) from Duarte et al. 2025.

bridge_axioms.name: carbon_permanence_discount
bridge_axioms.description: Blue carbon credits require buffer pool deductions to account for reversibility risk from natural and anthropogenic disturbances
bridge_axioms.formula: IF gross_credits_tCO2(Site, G) AND risk_profile(Site, R) THEN net_credits_tCO2(Site, G * (1 - buffer_rate))

buffer_pool_fraction.extraction_note: 10-25% buffer pool deduction for blue carbon projects. Range reflects VCS/Verra methodology requirements and site-specific risk profiles from Lovelock et al. 2025.

bridge_axioms.name: carbon_price_sensitivity
bridge_axioms.description: Ecosystem service value from blue carbon is highly sensitive to voluntary carbon market price fluctuations
bridge_axioms.formula: IF sequestration_tCO2_yr(Site, S) AND carbon_price_usd(Market, P) THEN esv_sensitivity(Site, S * dP/P)

price_range_usd_per_tCO2.extraction_note: VCM price range $5-50/tCO2. Central estimate $30 based on S&P Global Platts DBC-1 blue carbon benchmark. Low end reflects low-quality credits; high end reflects premium blue carbon with co-benefits.

esv_elasticity_to_price.extraction_note: Near-unit elasticity: carbon ESV scales approximately linearly with credit price. Slight deviations from transaction cost structure.

bridge_axioms.name: coral_reef_wave_attenuation_coefficient
bridge_axioms.description: Coral reef structural complexity determines wave energy reduction, with species composition and reef depth modulating attenuation efficiency
bridge_axioms.formula: IF reef_condition(Site, C) AND reef_depth_m(Site, D) THEN wave_energy_reduction_percent(Site, f(C, D))

wave_energy_reduction_healthy_percent.extraction_note: 97% wave energy reduction for healthy reef from Beck et al. 2018 and Ferrario et al. 2014 meta-analysis. Represents intact reef crest and flats.

wave_energy_reduction_degraded_percent.extraction_note: Degraded reef attenuation from flattening and loss of structural complexity. Wider uncertainty reflects variable degradation states.

depth_sensitivity_percent_per_10cm.extraction_note: 2% change in flood risk per 10cm reef depth change from Beck et al. 2018 sensitivity analysis.

bridge_axioms.name: mangrove_storm_surge_reduction
bridge_axioms.description: Mangrove forests attenuate storm surge height as water passes through the root and canopy structure, with reduction proportional to mangrove width
bridge_axioms.formula: IF mangrove_width_km(Site, W) AND storm_category(Event, Cat) THEN surge_reduction_cm(Site, W * rate)

surge_reduction_cm_per_km.extraction_note: 5-50 cm/km storm surge reduction from Montgomery et al. 2019. Central estimate 20 cm/km for typical mangrove density. Wide range reflects variation in forest structure and storm intensity.

protection_value_usd_per_km_per_yr.extraction_note: Per-km protection value derived from Menendez et al. 2020 global flood protection model. Range from cross-regional variation.

bridge_axioms.name: seagrass_sediment_stabilization
bridge_axioms.description: Seagrass meadows stabilize coastal sediments through root binding and wave dampening, preventing erosion and reducing turbidity
bridge_axioms.formula: IF seagrass_area_ha(Site, A) AND seagrass_density(Site, D) THEN erosion_prevention_value_usd_yr(Site, A * V_ha)

erosion_prevention_value_usd_ha_yr.extraction_note: Range $2,500-15,000/ha/yr from Ondiviela et al. 2025 wave attenuation review and Nordlund et al. 2023 services review. Central estimate geometric mean.

wave_attenuation_percent.extraction_note: Seagrass wave attenuation 20-70% depending on meadow density and species. From comprehensive review by Ondiviela et al. 2025.

bridge_axioms.name: reef_insurance_trigger_value
bridge_axioms.description: Parametric insurance products for coral reefs use wind speed or wave height thresholds to trigger rapid restoration funding after storm damage
bridge_axioms.formula: IF wind_speed_kmh(Event, W) AND W > threshold THEN insurance_payout(Site, P) AND restoration_funding(Site, P * coverage_rate)

wind_speed_trigger_kmh.extraction_note: Wind speed >130 km/h typical trigger for reef insurance products, based on Mesoamerican Reef Insurance program and Reguero et al. 2025 hybrid restoration economics.

average_payout_usd_per_event.extraction_note: Typical payout range based on Mesoamerican Reef Insurance program. Actual payouts vary by coverage area and storm severity.

bridge_axioms.name: mpa_spillover_fisheries_value
bridge_axioms.description: Biomass accumulation within MPAs generates spillover of adult fish and larval export to adjacent fishing grounds, increasing catches beyond MPA boundaries
bridge_axioms.formula: IF mpa_biomass_ratio(Site, R) AND mpa_boundary_km(Site, B) THEN adjacent_catch_multiplier(Site, f(R, B))

adjacent_catch_increase_multiplier.extraction_note: 1.5-3x catch increase in areas adjacent to well-managed MPAs. Central estimate 2x from Hopf et al. 2024 and spillover literature. Range reflects MPA age, size, and habitat connectivity.

spillover_distance_km.extraction_note: Effective spillover distance 1-15 km depending on species mobility and habitat continuity. From Edgar et al. 2014 NEOLI analysis.

bridge_axioms.name: marine_ecotourism_elasticity
bridge_axioms.description: Visitor willingness-to-pay for marine ecotourism is elastic to ecosystem condition, declining as coral cover, fish abundance, or water clarity decrease
bridge_axioms.formula: IF coral_cover_loss_percent(Site, L) THEN wtp_decline_percent(Site, f(L))

wtp_decline_per_10pct_coral_loss_percent.extraction_note: 15-30% WTP decline per 10% coral cover loss from Wolff et al. 2022 Maui study and Spalding et al. 2017. Central estimate 22% as midpoint.

minimum_coral_cover_for_tourism_percent.extraction_note: Below 10-30% coral cover, tourism appeal drops precipitously. From Spalding et al. 2017 global tourism mapping.

bridge_axioms.name: coral_bleaching_tourism_loss
bridge_axioms.description: Coral bleaching events driven by thermal stress reduce reef tourism revenue proportionally to bleaching severity and duration
bridge_axioms.formula: IF degree_heating_weeks(Site, DHW) THEN tourism_revenue_decline_percent(Site, f(DHW))

revenue_decline_per_dhw_percent.extraction_note: 3-12% revenue decline per degree-heating-week from Wolff et al. 2022 Maui analysis and broader bleaching-tourism literature. Central estimate 7%.

recovery_time_years_mild.extraction_note: Mild bleaching recovery 2-5 years from Hughes et al. 2018 spatial/temporal bleaching patterns.

recovery_time_years_severe.extraction_note: Severe bleaching recovery 7-15 years. Some reefs may not recover to pre-bleaching state.

bridge_axioms.name: species_richness_insurance_value
bridge_axioms.description: Higher species richness acts as biological insurance, reducing portfolio risk by buffering ecosystem service delivery against environmental variability
bridge_axioms.formula: IF species_richness_increase_percent(Site, R) THEN risk_reduction_percent(Site, f(R))

risk_reduction_per_10pct_richness_increa.extraction_note: 8-15% risk reduction per 10% species richness increase. Derived from Edgar et al. 2014 finding that biodiversity-rich MPAs show more stable ecosystem services. Central estimate 11%.

functional_redundancy_threshold_species.extraction_note: Minimum species count for functional redundancy that provides insurance effect. Varies by functional group composition.

bridge_axioms.name: debt_for_nature_swap_ratio
bridge_axioms.description: Sovereign debt-for-nature swaps convert distressed government debt into conservation funding at discounted rates, generating fiscal space for marine protection
bridge_axioms.formula: IF sovereign_debt_face_value(Country, D) AND discount_rate(Swap, R) THEN conservation_funding(Country, D * R * commitment_fraction)

debt_discount_fraction.extraction_note: 30-50% discount on face value typical for debt-for-nature swaps. Grounded in Seychelles restructured debt case evidence (Booth and Brooks 2023) and broader conservation finance literature.

conservation_commitment_fraction.extraction_note: 15-50% of swap proceeds committed to conservation activities. Seychelles debt restructuring implementation reports a 30% EEZ protection commitment (Booth and Brooks 2023).

bridge_axioms.name: blue_bond_coupon_premium
bridge_axioms.description: Blue bonds may trade at a small yield premium (greenium) compared to conventional bonds due to investor demand for sustainable ocean finance
bridge_axioms.formula: IF bond_face_value(Instrument, V) AND greenium_bps(Market, G) THEN annual_cost_savings(Instrument, V * G / 10000)

greenium_basis_points.extraction_note: 2-15 bps greenium for blue/green bonds from Wang et al. 2023 and Tucker et al. 2022. Central estimate 8 bps as midpoint. Market still developing with limited issuances.

typical_issuance_size_usd_million.extraction_note: Blue bond issuances range from $10M (sovereign first issuances) to $500M (development bank instruments). From Tucker et al. 2022.

bridge_axioms.name: ecosystem_restoration_roi
bridge_axioms.description: Active ecosystem restoration generates measurable return on investment through recovered ecosystem services, with benefit-cost ratios varying by habitat type
bridge_axioms.formula: IF restoration_cost_usd(Site, C) AND habitat_type(Site, H) THEN bcr(Site, f(H, C))

bcr_mangrove.extraction_note: Mangrove restoration BCR 6.35-15x from Zeng et al. 2025. Highest BCR among coastal habitats.

bcr_coral.extraction_note: Coral restoration BCR 3-8x from Reguero et al. 2025 and Bayraktarov et al. 2016. Includes hybrid restoration approaches.

bcr_seagrass.extraction_note: Seagrass restoration BCR 2-7x from Orth et al. 2020. Varies with restoration method and site conditions.

bridge_axioms.name: mpa_network_connectivity_bonus
bridge_axioms.description: Networks of connected MPAs provide greater portfolio-level value than isolated reserves through larval connectivity, adult spillover, and risk diversification
bridge_axioms.formula: IF mpa_network_size(Network, N) AND connectivity_index(Network, C) THEN portfolio_value_bonus_percent(Network, f(N, C))

portfolio_value_increase_percent.extraction_note: 15-30% portfolio value increase from network connectivity. From Gaines et al. 2010 network design optimization and connectivity modeling literature.

minimum_network_size_sites.extraction_note: Minimum 3-10 connected sites for meaningful network benefits. From network design literature.

bridge_axioms.name: climate_adaptation_avoided_cost
bridge_axioms.description: Ecosystem-based adaptation avoids future infrastructure costs by using natural capital for coastal defense, with benefit-cost ratios comparing EbA to grey infrastructure
bridge_axioms.formula: IF eba_investment_usd(Site, I) AND grey_alternative_usd(Site, G) THEN bcr(Site, G / I)

eba_bcr.extraction_note: BCR 2-10x for ecosystem-based adaptation vs grey infrastructure. From Lumbroso et al. 2025 Caribbean NBS analysis and broader EbA literature. Central estimate 5x.

cost_savings_percent_vs_grey.extraction_note: 30-80% cost savings for EbA vs equivalent grey infrastructure. From Gattuso et al. 2018 ocean solutions review. Wide range reflects site-specific conditions.

export_metadata.regeneration_reason: BA-001 DOI correction and coefficient update
